div.style: float:left; text-transform:uppercase; font-family:'Open Sans', Sans-Serif; font-size:14px; margin-right:7px; margin-top:1px; color:#144482; font-weight:bold;

img.style: width: 41px; vertical-align: middle; padding: 10px; border-left: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); border-right: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12);

span.span: to access the "NEW" Remote Learning Guidance for Families

div.span: Below are some Free Internet Access Locations around the community:

span.span: We have setup Outdoor WIFI Access Points in the parking lots of these buildings: Raymond, Navin, Edgewood, Creekview, and MHS (weight room parking lot) to help.

div.span: Spectrum has Free WiFi access points around the city and county to access the internet. If you go to: (
) and type in the zip code or address, it will show you there "Free" access points.
Marysville and Raymond locations have Free WiFi access in their parking lot areas from 7:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m.
The City of Marysville has Free WiFi access at the Pavillion, Eljer Park (Restroom Area), and the Pool at Legion Park for the community.

span.div: Student and staff safety is a top priority at Marysville Schools. In our efforts to keep our students, staff and families informed with the latest information on coronavirus, or COVID-19, please use this page as a reference for District communications regarding coronavirus and other helpful resources.

a.span: Video Message from Superintendent Diane Allen
Video Message from Superintendent Diane Allen
Video Message from Superintendent Diane Allen
School Closure Information from the Ohio Department of Education
Video message from Superintendent Diane Allen

li.a: Parent Resource - Talking to Children about Coronavirus

a.span: Centers for Disease Control - FAQ Coronavirus and Children
Ohio Department of Health - Coronavirus update and prevention information

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #272727; background-color: #ffffff; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #272727; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: We encourage all students, staff and community members to follow these

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #1155cc; background-color: #ffffff; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

a.span: recommendations from the Centers for Disease Control:

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Avoid touching your eyes, nose and mouth with unwashed hands.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer with at least 60% alcohol content.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Stay at home if you are sick.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue, and throw the tissue in the trash.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #272727; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: #ffffff; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

p.a: HELP SLOW THE SPREAD OF COVID-19

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #333333; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: WHAT SHOULD WE DO IF A STUDENT BECOMES SICK WHILE AT SCHOOL?

li.style: line-height:1.38;background-color:#ffffff;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:2pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;text-align:left

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #282828; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Students who appear to have symptoms at arrival or become ill during the day should be isolated promptly in a room separate from other students and sent home. School nurses and clinic aides have specific protocols for handling such cases. If a serious medical emergency occurs, 9-1-1 will be called to support.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #333333; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: CAN STUDENTS STAY HOME IF THEY HAVE CONCERNS AND COUNT AS AN EXCUSED ABSENCE?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #282828; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Sick leave policies remain in effect and students will be excused in accordance with the student handbook.
to access information in regards to the Families First Coronavirus Response Act (FFCRA)

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #333333; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: WHAT SHOULD WE DO IF AN EMPLOYEE BECOMES SICK WHILE AT SCHOOL?

li.style: line-height:1.38;background-color:#ffffff;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;padding:2pt 0pt 12pt 0pt;text-align:left

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #282828; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.span: Employees who appear to have symptoms should be sent home. School nurses and clinic aides have specific protocols for handling such cases. If a serious medical emergency occurs, 9-1-1 will be called to support.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #333333; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: CAN EMPLOYEES STAY HOME IF THEY ARE SICK AND COUNT AS AN EXCUSED ABSENCE?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #282828; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Sick leave policies remain in effect and employees will be excused in accordance with the sick leave policies currently in place.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #333333; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: WHAT IF AN EMPLOYEE IS SICK AND DOES NOT HAVE ANY LEAVE REMAINING?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; color: #282828; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Employees that have exhausted all sick leave and continue to be sick may advance sick leave or elect to use personal or vacation leave, if available to cover the absence. If these options are exhausted, then the employee may request to take unpaid leave under the Unpaid Leave of Absence policy.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: WILL THERE BE ANY DELAYS WITH PAY DUE TO A FULL DISTRICT CLOSING?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: No, there should not be any issues and payroll will remain on schedule.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #333333; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: IF WE ARE CLOSED, WHAT ARE THE EXPECTATIONS OF TEACHERS/CERTIFIED STAFF?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Classroom teachers and other certified staff will be expected to work from home during school closing.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: IF WE ARE CLOSED, WHAT ARE THE EXPECTATIONS OF NON-TEACHING STAFF?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: All support staff will receive direct communication regarding job duties and expectations from their principal or supervisor.

strong.span: WILL CLASSIFIED (NON-TEACHING) STAFF BE PAID IN THE EVENT OF A SCHOOL CLOSURE?

li.span: At this time, our plan is to pay all regular, contracted classified (non-teaching) employees their regular daily rate in the event of a school closure due to the COVID-19 public epidemic.

div.h3: SCHOOL CLOSING AND EVENT CANCELLATION INFORMATION

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; color: #333333; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: IF WE ARE CLOSED, WHAT ARE THE EXPECTATIONS OF TEACHERS/CERTIFIED STAFF?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Classrooms Teachers and other certified staff will be expected to work from home during school closing.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: IF WE ARE CLOSED, WHAT ARE THE EXPECTATIONS OF NON-TEACHING STAFF?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: All support staff will receive direct communication regarding job duties and expectations from their principal or supervisor.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: WHAT IF WE ARE CLOSED AND AN EMPLOYEE IS SICK OR ALREADY HAD OTHER TIME OFF SCHEDULED AND CANNOT WORK FROM HOME?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If the employee is sick, they would use sick time and if they had a vacation or personal day scheduled, they would still use that time as arranged.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

strong.span: IF SCHOOL IS CANCELED HOW WILL SCHOOL EVENTS BE HANDLED?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If school is canceled, events and activities will be canceled as well.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: All School Trips scheduled for spring break have been postponed.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 12pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Japan trip for June 2020 is postponed.

span.style: background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

span.span: Online learning is currently taking place for our students due to the cornonavirus. If you have questions, please communicate with your child's teacher or principal.

li.span: Teachers and principals are available virutually during regular school hours to support students and families.

During Spring Break, March 23-27, teachers and principals will not be holding regular office hours. No new assignments will be posted. Beginning March 30, new assignments and virtual office hours will begin for the week. As remote learning continues through May 1, new assignments will be posted throughout this time period.

a.span: Technology Frequently Asked Questions for Students (FAQ)
Click Here for information about our Food Plan

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial; font-size: 14pt; font-weight: 700; text-decoration-line: underline; white-space: pre-wrap; text-align: center
font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Marysville Schools is offering a way for parents/guardians to connect with possible child care providers during this challenging time due to the coronavirus.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Are you interested in providing private child care services during the school closure for parents/guardians in need due to the coronavirus?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If yes, please click on the Child Care Information link below.

li.style: list-style-type: circle; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Once on the Child Care Information screen, click on the form in order to provide your First Name, Last Initial, Age and your Phone Number. PLEASE NOTE: this information will be open for the public to see from our website.

li.style: list-style-type: square; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If you want your information removed, please contact Amy Weinbrecht at 937-578-6100 or email her at

span.style: font-size: 11pt; color: #1155cc; background-color: transparent; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap
font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Parents/Guardians will access this Child Care Information and may reach out to you directly to inquire about possible child care services.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Marysville Schools is simply making your information available to families during this challenging time.

span.style: font-size: 14pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; font-style: italic; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Are you in need of child care for your child/children during the school closure due to the coronavirus?

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: If yes,

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt

p.span: please click on the Child Care Information link below.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Once on the Child Care Information screen, you will see private individuals and their contact information.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: This is your decision as a parent/guardian if you choose to establish a private arrangement with the individual for child care services.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Marysville Schools is

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-weight: 700; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: NOT

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: screening any of the individuals who will appear on this list. Parents/Guardians must decide next steps if they want to interview the person, screen individuals, etc… before making arrangements.

li.style: list-style-type: disc; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap

p.span: Marysville Schools assumes no responsibility as the district is simply making possible private child care provider information available to parents/guardians. This is a personal decision by each parent/guardian.

p.a: Click here to see the Child Care Information
